fields.description: Currently in JIRA, if the priority of ticket is changed, there is no way to force the users to enter comment. In some scenario, it will be good if the users can be forced to type in comment when they change the priority.
fields.summary: To create a popup to capture the comment and make the comment as mandatory when the priority of an issue is changed

fields.description:
h4. Current scenario:

The only option to have assignee required is upon changing the *Allow unassigned issues* setting under *General Configuration*, which affects all projects and forces the user to set *Default Assignee* for each project.  
h4. Suggestion:

The user wants the *Assignee* field to be set as required and at the same time remove the *Automatic* assignee for a project, this allows the user to be able to assign the issue from a list of users instead of setting an automatic user during issue creation. 
h4. Work-around:

Unfortunately, this workaround is not valid for *Atlassian Cloud*. Assignee field can be marked as required upon using a 3rd party add-on, as per steps listed on [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Making+%27Assignee%27+field+required+when+%27Allow+unassigned+issues%27+is+turned+ON+in+General+Configuration] article.
fields.summary: Ability to allow unassigned issues Turned "OFF" without Default Assignee Required

fields.description: The ability to disable internal comments in JIRA Service Desk is a suggestion that has been raised.
fields.summary: Ability to disable internal comments in JIRA Service Desk.

fields.description: If JIRA is down when attempting to open the Issue Collector, the various jsonp requests that it sends for configuration are met with the generic "Something went wrong / moving mountains" error HTML page. This results in a syntax error as it attempts to eval that as javascript on the client. Worse is that there are cache headers on that response so all subsequent attempts to open the issue collector fail with the same error until the cache expires (set to 1 hour).
fields.summary: Issue Collector jsonp requests fail with HTML - gets cached

fields.description:
We would like subtasks to be used under all other types of demands like bugs or Epics or Suggestions, etc etc. 

This would include the time to be deducted from the "parent" demand.
fields.summary: subtask under other type of demands

fields.description:
Hi There,

We have a lot of information in every sub-task ticket and we would like to organize it under categories. 

The tab solution is not always convenient for us since we prefer all the information in one tab.

The Default fields: Details, Description, People, Dates, etc.. are great but not enough, I would like to add some more/ rename them. I understand this is not possible currently but this will help the user focus and help him find a certain piece of information in the big jumble of words.

The next level would be to customize the size/color/font of the screens.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Customizing Default Fields in screens

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
h3. The JIRA audit log does not include screen changes described in [Auditing in JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/auditing-in-jira-applications-818578846.html].
h3. *Repro steps*
 # Log in as a user with the *JIRA Administrators* global permission.
 # Create a new screen (*gg* > *Screens* > *Add Screen*),
 # Add fields to the first tab on the screen.
 # Go to *gg* > *Screen Schemes* and select any screen scheme.
 # Select *Associate an issue operation with a screen*.
 # Choose any issue operation and select the screen you just created.
 # Select *Add*.
 # View the Audig Log (*gg* > *Audit Log*).

h3. *Expected Results*

The Audit Log contains events describing the following changes:
 * Screen field configuration changed
 * Screen scheme edited
 * Etc

h3. *Actual Results*

No audit log entries exist which refer to screen changes of any kind.
fields.summary: Audit log does not include screen changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 A session timeout error is shown when bulk editing sub-tasks. It happens only when selecting bulk edit by clicking on the (...) button above the sub-tasks list inside a parent issue (see screenshot below).

!bulk-operation-subtask.png|thumbnail!
{code:java}
Your session timed out while you were in the process of selecting issues to perform a bulk operation on. This means that we have lost the information that we collected thus far from the wizard. You will need to try the bulk operation again from the start. Sorry for the inconvenience.{code}
 
h3. Environment

There is no specific environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue with sub-tsks
 # Above the list of sub-tasks click on (...) > Bulk Operation
 # Select all sub-tasks and click on next

h3. Expected Results

 

The page to select the bulk operation should appear
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the UI
{code:java}
Your session timed out while you were in the process of selecting issues to perform a bulk operation on. This means that we have lost the information that we collected thus far from the wizard. You will need to try the bulk operation again from the start. Sorry for the inconvenience.{code}
 

This one appears on jlog
{code:java}
/secure/views/bulkedit/BulkMigrateSetFields.jspa [c.a.j.w.a.issue.bulkedit.BulkMigrate] Bulk edit bean unexpectedly null. Perhaps session was lost (e.g. when URL used is different to base URL in General Configuration)?{code}
 

This appears on aalog
{code:java}
"POST /rest/webResources/1.0/resources HTTP/1.0" 200 1039 37579 "https://xxx.atlassian.net/secure/views/bulkedit/SessionTimeoutMessage.jspa?timeout-cause=bulk.operation.session.timeout.message" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko"{code}
 
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
 # Go to Issues > Search for issues
 # Search for parent issue (parent = TEST-1), it’ll list all sub-tasks
 # Click on (...) > Bulk edit
fields.summary: Session timeout while bulk editing sub-tasks

fields.description:
h2. User story

As a developer, the only thing I usually care in an issue are the issue contents. I want to see them the moment I arrive at an issue.
h2. What happens instead

See attached screenshots. On a 15" Macbook with Retina display there's nothing on the issue page of interest to a developer. 

See https://dmitriid.com/i/gm4dsnjxgi2dmojw.png and https://dmitriid.com/i/gm4dsojxgizdgojz.png

It may be of some use to a manager, but I doubt even that,

h2. Suggestion

Inline all "meta information" for a ticket. There's absolutely no reason for every field to be split into two lines.

Bring issue contents front and center. 

h2. System details

OS: macOS 10.12.5
Browser: Safari 10.1.1
fields.summary: It is impossible for a developer to see issue details in new UI

fields.description:

h3. Suggested Solution
Give option for admin to set the custom field by default to be "Required"

h3. Why this is important
Admin will only need to configure the "Required" configuration once.
fields.summary: Ability to set Custom Field to be "Required" by default

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on Edit Global Settings in JIRA Time Tracking page, it always shows minutes even after changing it to hour or day. It doesn't display the current settings which can lead to confusion. Though, the default unit is still working as what has been configured.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# GG + Time tracking or Click on cog icon > Issues > Time Tracking
# Click on Edit Global Settings
# Set the default unit to hour
# Save the changes, follow Time Tracking link once again
# Click on Edit Global Settings once again

h3. Expected Results
The form loads the current setting of the default unit

h3. Actual Results
* *Default unit for time tracking* is reverted back to _Minute_
* *Time display format* is reverted back to _Pretty ..._
 
h3. Notes
The default unit is still working even if it shows minute.
fields.summary: The default unit in JIRA time tracking form always show minutes

h3. Summary

For project created as a *Business*, the assigned to column options are limited to 10 spots only, user request to be able to a longer list similar to the viewing the full detail of the issue in order make assigning based on the list easier. User prefers if possible to customize the list based on users who have access to the project.  ** 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the *Business* project
 # Make sure the project is viewed in the *Board View*
 # Click on an *Issue* > In the pop-up, Click on the *Assigned to* column
 # The drop-down menu with the list of users are limited to *10 users* only

h3. Expected Results

To be able to scroll more users and choose the user from the list instead of being limited to only 10 options. 
h3. Actual Results

Limited to 10 users within the drop-down list to scroll and click on. 
h3. Workaround

The workaround is rather simple, just type the name of the user in the *Assigned To* column and it will pop-up as an option.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When saving a filter using a query like below:
{code:java}
development[commits].all > 0{code}
The filter is automatically changed adding "" in the 'all' making the query unusable with the following error:
 !Screen Shot 2017-07-19 at 4.11.16 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click in 'Search for Issues'
 # Use the following query:
{code:java}
development[commits].all > 0{code}

 # Save as a filter

h3. Expected Results

The filter will be saved properly without changing the query.

h3. Actual Results

The query is automatically changed causing an error on the query making unsearchable.

h3. Workaround

Note that the act of saving the filter *actually succeeds*. In order to verify this, reload the URL (ending with {{?filter=12345}}) and see that your updated filter now loads and issues are returned.
fields.summary: Saving a JQL query 'development[commits].all' automatically change the query becoming unsearchable

When performing JSON import for the first time, there is an error thrown in the UI saying "cannot create users xxxx: User 'xxxx' has no unique key mapping". However, in the User Management, we can see that all the users can be imported successfully. The JSON importer is stopped due to this error and we need to perform the JSON import again for the second time to import the projects and issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Sign up for a new Cloud Instance
# Under JIRA Administration, go to System
# Click External System Import and choose JSON
# Upload the JSON file and begin import

h3. Expected Results
The projects, issues, and users can be imported successfully

h3. Actual Results
# The import is halted with none issues and projects imported
# There is an error message: Cannot Create user xxxx: User 'xxxx' has no unique key mapping
# In User Management, all the users can be imported successfully. However, due to this errors, we need to do JSON import again for the second time to import the projects and issues

h3. Workaround
Retry the import again
fields.summary: When performing JSON Import, there is an error thrown in UI about cannot create users due to no unique key mapping; despite the users are imported successfully

fields.description:
h3. Description

Since the introduction of [Atlassian Accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/the-upgrade-to-atlassian-account-873871204.html] (November 2016) the behaviour of the endpoint */rest/api/2/user* has changed, as documented in the below KB:
- [User management REST API changes in JIRA Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/user-management-rest-api-changes-in-jira-cloud-858756548.html]

This changes are still not reflected in the [JIRA Cloud REST API Reference|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/] documentation page.


h3. Workaround
In order to have better control on your users (and to be able to set their passwords) you may want to configure [SAML single sign-on|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-873871238.html].
fields.summary: The documentation for the endpoint /rest/api/2/user contains outdated information

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

By default, when installing an Atlassian Connect add-on, it creates a new role as *atlassian-addons-project-access* on all projects. And in the project permission scheme, it added the role *atlassian-addons-project-access* to gain access to all permission. 

This creates a problem for the scenario below, where a user (not JIRA Administrator) is given *Administer Projects* with limited permissions. The user gains the ability to add his user to the project role *atlassian-addons-project-access* and granted access to all permissions.

Note: 
* Project Administrator has *no* ability to change the project permission. 
* Project Administrator has the ability to add users to role

h2. Steps to Replicate

# Create a project
# Create a normal user without JIRA Administrator global permission
# Grant the user to *Administer Projects* permission on the project permission scheme
# Install an add-on
# Using the user navigate to the project setting permission scheme
# Notice that user is unable to change the project permission
# Navigate to the *Users and roles* page
# Notice that user able to add another user to role *atlassian-addons-project-access* and gain access to all permission

h2. Expected Behavior

Project administrators are unable to add any user to the role *atlassian-addons-project-access* as it is meant to be add-on usage only. This would prevent them from granting themselves full permission for the project.

h2. Actual Behavior

Project administrators are able to grant full permission by adding themselves to the role *atlassian-addons-project-access*

h2. Workaround

You can manually change the add-on permission group by adding the groups to the permission scheme and remove the project role *atlassian-addons-project-access*, that will ensure that the add-on function as it should and project administrators were not able to elevate their permission. 

Do note of the following limitation by the workaround:
* New add-on installation will recreate role and added back to the permission scheme
* It might require you to perform clean up if this bug is fixed
fields.summary: Add-On Project Role allows Project Administrators to Gain Access to All Permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA will only consider issues in Sprints as completed if its status is mapped to the very last column on the board. 

The customer would like to see the issues with status Cancelled on the board and would like to be able to close the Sprint without the warning message that these issues are not completed. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to have some statuses (such as Cancelled), to not be shown on the board and be able to complete the Sprint.
fields.summary: Possibility to close the Sprint when there are unmapped statuses (such as Cancelled)

fields.description:
Hi,

I want to create report for finding TAT between 2 particular workflow statuses in a particular project. For e.g I want to create a report where I can see how much time was spent in resolving a ticket ever since it was created. It could be specific to a single project.

Nidhi
fields.summary: How to create a report on TAT(Turn around time)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to utilize 'Account' (Tempo Account Custom Field) in gadgets in JIRA
 * Two Dimensional Filter Statistics
 * Pie Chart
h3. Environment

 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install 'Tempo Planner' add-on
 # Configure an 'Account' in Tempo
 # Create an issue in JIRA and set Account field to the account created in Tempo Planner
 # On a JIRA Dashboard add a gadget and try selecting the Account custom field

h3. Expected Results

Able to select 'Account'
h3. Actual Results

No Account field shows up
h3. Notes

Customer has stated they've previously used these fields in the gadget previously but disappeared around June 20th.
 They've contacted Tempo regarding this issue and received the following response:

"I'm afraid that this is functionality controlled by JIRA. Tempo Account field is a based on a JIRA custom field, and JIRA controls their availability in their various screens and gadgets. Unfortunately we can't do anything about this."

*Workaround*

None
fields.summary: Unable to utilize 'Account' (Tempo Account Custom Field) in gadgets in JIRA

fields.description:
This issue presents as a generic error to the person importing. Diagnosis requires looking at the logs, which only Atlassian has access to so in turn requires contacting support.
In the logs the error presents as (partial stack trace):
{code}
stack:	 com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: Read timed out
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper
{code}

This bug is more likely to be seen when Atlassian user management systems (specifically IDP) are under higher than normal load. Retrying the import after some time is usually expected the resolve the issue.

The original cause of this was the introduction of a 5 second timeout in the user management system by default. Since then we've increased the timeout to 30 seconds for user manipulation. Additional work needs to be done to speed user management up.
fields.summary: Timeout during import when importing users

fields.description:
it would be great if we can custom a pop up message for site visitors who place tickets via issue collector.

I use issue collector to let visitors to apply for jobs at my company and it would be great to appear a custom message after submitting like thank you for...  you'll get back to you shortly..

 

Regards,
fields.summary: "Thank you" message after submitting issue using issue collector

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Create one or multiple users through the /admin/users/invite URL, and you got no feedback or error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a previously created user with an email address in lower case: {{test@test.com}}
# Try to create a new user on {{<instancename>/admin/users/invite}} using an existing email address, but in uppercase: {{Test@test.com}}

h3. Expected Results
You should receive the message *1 of the users already exists and is active.*
 !Screen Shot 2017-07-14 at 5.16.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The interface spins for a while, and you got no error message or feedback.
On browser console, you should see the following error:
{code}Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 409 () {code}

h3.Workaround
None - you need to verify manually if there is an existing user with the desired email address in upper or lower case.
fields.summary: When you try to create multiple users at once, you got no error and the users are not created

fields.description:
On service desk tickets, if you click to add a comment, it is way too easy to accidentally send an internal comment to the customer.

Separating the Internal Comment and Share with Customers into different tabs on the comment field will help reduce the accidental internal comments being sent to customers and vice versa.
fields.summary: Seperate comment and Share with Customer in different tabs.
OAuth error when HipChat is connected to two JIRA instances if one of them are created from an export of another

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA administrator, I want to restrict other users from viewing the Activity Stream on the user profile.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to restrict the access to Activity Stream section from the user profile.

h3. Why this is important
Although the premise of JIRA where you can only see what you have permission to view/edit, certain customers would find useful to restrict the access to Activity Stream for security or privacy purposes.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Restrict the access to Activity Stream section under the user profile in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The create branch feature in JIRA redirects you to the default branch in bitbucket.

h3. Suggested change
For some customers it would be useful to have the option to customize the default folder where the create branch feature in JIRA redirects you once you select it.
fields.summary: Allow customize the destination folder in Bitbucket when using the Create Branch feature in JIRA.

Note that this problem does not happen for everyone.

*Symptoms*
Having the new JIRA experience on and visiting a board, I can't see the Backlog and Active Sprints/Kanban. I see a blue sidebar with items like Dashboards and Projects, instead of a grey one with project related items.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence page does not render issues of [JIRA Calendar Plugin (JIRA issues calendar)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar/cloud/overview].

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.0.0-4871d80
** JIRA issues calendar macro is somehow only available in SPA page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue at JIRA project
# Add _JIRA issues calendar_ widget to JIRA dashboard
# Verify that the widget renders issues as expected at JIRA dashboard
**  !Screenshot 2017-07-13 14.40.11.png|thumbnail! 
# Add _JIRA issues calendar_ macro to Confluence page
# Verify that the macro does not show any issues on Confluence page
**  !Screenshot 2017-07-13 14.43.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
JIRA issues calendar renders issues on Confluence page as well

h3. Actual Results
Although no error occurs at user facing page, JIRA internally throws PSQLException caused by inserting query to OAuth table and complains WARN log saying:
{noformat}
Error occurred while rendering a page
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* Confluence needs to eliminate the macro if it's currently unsupported

h3.Workaround
* None
fields.summary: JIRA Calendar Plugin does not work on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is not possible to import Bitbucket issues via JSON importer	

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export issues from Bitbucket repository using the steps outlined on [this CAC KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/export-or-import-issue-data-330797432.html]
# Try to import JSON file by selecting the JSON option in the JIRA Import Wizard - External System Import

h3. Expected Results
Issues are created

h3. Actual Results
Issues are not created. Message: "No issues and projects imported"
When clicking on the download detailed log of this report, an message like the following is shown:
{noformat}

Possible workarounds:
# A simple JSON to CSV converter does not work. You have to re-format the data using something like the https://bitbucket.org/Enharmonic/bitbucket-to-jira-issue-conversion tool (that is outdated and not supported).
# Download and install a test JIRA Server (latest release) locally. Use the native BB importer to import the issues in there. Follow the steps in below KB to merge the 2 instances together (since you only have 1 Cloud instance you can skip step #1 of the KB):
#- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-merge-two-different-jira-cloud-applications-together-779160767.html

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Older versions of JIRA did insert a timestamp, for when you uploaded two files with the same filename, the second one would have appended a timestamp to its name i.e: file-11-11-2011, this doesn't happen anymore, and due to that, you're not being able to reference files with the same filename in an issue.

h3. Environment
* Tested within Cloud instances
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Attach a file i.e: file.txt
# Attach another file with the same name 'file.txt'
# Try to reference one time each file in a comment (print below), 
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
# Now check that both referenced files points to the same URL which would end up in downloading the same file, not the new version:
#*  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Have JIRA to append timestamps to differ files and be able to reference both files in a comment


h3. Actual Results
Only the older file is being able to be referenced in a comment and no timestamp is appended to differ those
 
h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Attachments with the same name, can leave one attachment not able to be referenced in comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As specified on JIRA Rest API documentation, the project endpoint returns all the projects that is visible to the user. If the a user granted with JIRA administrator group calls the endpoint, all of the projects will be returned. The endpoint works as expected for non JIRA administrator user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a JIRA administrator user, call https://cloud_instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/project

h3. Expected Results

Only the visible projects as, specified on *Projects* Menu > *View All Projects*, should be returned. User cannot browse through all the projects on the rest api response, as some of them will fail with permission errors.

h3. Actual Results

All Projects will be listed, similar to *Cog* Menu > Projects. This is list does not guarantee that the user has browse data permission.

h3.Workaround

Use a standard user (non-JIRA administrator) for the rest api calls.
fields.summary: /rest/api/2/project endpoint shows incorrectly returns all project for admin user

fields.description:
(!) *Please notice that this only applies to the new infrastructure. The old endpoints are still working fine in the old infrastructure* (!) h3. Summary Running a JIRA backup from command line or from a script fails. The endpoint {{rest/obm/1.0/runbackup}} is now returning: 404 - page not found As mentioned in the KB article "[How to Automate Backups for JIRA Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-automate-backups-for-jira-cloud-applications-779160659.html]" this is not fully supported but, if the endpoint has been removed, then we should either update the documentation or make it work again. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Either use the [Atlassian Labs automatic-cloud-backup script|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/automatic-cloud-backup/src] or run the below commands: {noformat} curl -D- -c cookie.txt -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":"EMAIL", "password":"PASSWORD" }' -X POST https://HOSTNAME/rest/auth/1/session curl --cookie cookie.txt --header "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -H "X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST https://HOSTNAME/rest/obm/1.0/runbackup -d '{"cbAttachments":"true" }' {noformat} h3. Expected Results A JIRA backup is started and you can check the progress by calling the below endpoint: {noformat} curl --cookie cookie.txt https://HOSTNAME/rest/obm/1.0/getprogress.json {noformat} h3. Actual Results An error is returned instead: {noformat} curl --cookie cookie.txt --header "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -H "X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST https://HOSTNAME/rest/obm/1.0/runbackup -d '{"cbAttachments":"true" }' Oops, you've found a dead link. - JIRA

Oops, you've found a dead link.

  • Go back to the previous page
  • Go to the Home Page
Atlassian
{noformat} h3. Workaround There are new endpoints to be called that are working fine. However, please notice that automatic backup from script is not officially supported and therefore the endpoints can change again in the future without any previous notice. I have updated the existing script by doing the following (you can do the same in case the scripts won't work anymore in the future): # Open the developer tools in Chrome (or Firefox) # Run the backup from the UI # In the developer console check the endpoints used to run the backup and modify the existing scripts accordingly Below are the scripts I have just used to backup my JIRA and Confluence instances. Please use them at your own risk (and make sure you read and understand what's in there before running them): - [^Confluence-backup.sh] - [^JIRA-backup-new-endoints-12-2017.sh]
fields.summary: JIRA backup script returns 404 in the new infrastructure

fields.description:
This can pose a security issue. For example, information about the username can be used to perform dictionary attacks on the login page. Suggest just using the username stored in the session while editing your own profile, or a POST for editing other users

Steps to Reproduce: 
1. Go to View Ossue page. 
2. Click on the user in the user detail pop-up. Notice the username in the URL.

fields.summary: Importing Project type value in External System Import are case sensitive

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA shows _Create Branch_ link in _Development_ section even though loggedin user doesn't have an permission to visit link

!Screenshot_2017-07-12_10_06_54.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Hide "Create Branch" if user is not authorized to access link

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Hide "Create Branch" if user is not authorized to access link

fields.description: When trying to apply a custom field scheme to multiple projects, the content box used to choose the available projects is only 5 lines deep. This can make trying to apply a scheme to, say, 20+ projects very tedious and difficult. Having the ability to resize the content box would be a HUGE help. ALSO, nowhere does it say that you can hold "Ctrl" while selecting projects to choose multiple projects. I only happened to stumble upon this feature accidentally after previously creating a separate scheme for each project and wasting way too much time.
fields.summary: Quality of life improvement

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Search "Epic link" won't show the issue without manual re-index.
 
h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.1112.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen with the field "Epic link"
# Add the screen to a workflow transition
# Create an issue
# Perform the transition edited on step 2 and add a "Epic link"
# Search issues by "Epic link"

* If the issue is created with "Epic link" then the error is not reproducible
* If you fill another field during the transition and search the field value then it works

h3. Expected Results
All issues in epic are listed

h3. Actual Results
Issues are missing on search
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
* Run a project re-index
fields.summary: Epic link search doesn't work without manual re-index

fields.description:
When you click *Expand Source* for the JSON examples inside the table *Specific JSON File Examples* you get a tiny sliver of the screen with the example. In addition, it's not possible to select and copy the whole example. This issue makes the examples unusable.

Doc: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-json-776636779.html
fields.summary: JSON examples inside table are unusable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the {code}ORDER BY fixVersion{code} feature in the issue navigator orders the issues based on the first Fix Version name on the issue. 
 !order by fix version 1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want to see the fix versions ordered by name for an issue as well
fields.summary: If the issue has multiple fix versions sort these by name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When "Schedule issues" permission is granted to the current assignee, the assignee is not able to schedule his issues. The system displays the message:

{noformat}
Error
You cannot perform this operation because you do not have "Schedule" permission.
{noformat}

This problem started last week.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* 
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a SCRUM project
# Go to *Project settings > Permissions* 
# Click *Actions > Edit permissions*
# Grant *Schedule Issues* permission to the current user only
# Go back to the project and create an issue, assign to that issues and start a sprint
# Try to move that issue to the current sprint

h3. Expected Results

Issue is added to the sprint

h3. Actual Results

The issue is not added to the current sprint and the user receives the message:
{noformat}
Error
You cannot perform this operation because you do not have "Schedule" permission.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround

Grant "Schedule Issues" permission to a project role and add the user to that project role.
fields.summary: Current assignee cannot schedule issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Workflow steps with the property to disable Log Work for users in the designated steps are presenting inconsistent behavior.
h3. Environment
Cloud (check ticket label)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project (Software)
# Create a new workflow for the Story issue type
# Put in all workflow steps the following property:
{code}
jira.permission.work = denied
{code}

h3. Expected Results
In the steps where the property is applied, the user should not be able to log work.
h3. Actual Results
The user can log work, even if the property is there.
The following appear in the logs:
{code}
Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.work'>denied</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
{code}

h3.Workaround
NONE
fields.summary: Workflow property jira.permission.work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating an issue with a required field on JIRA, if you are creating within the backlog and after that click on the "Where is my field?" functionality the "Where is my field?" dialog box never loads it stays in a spinning wheel forever.

h3. How to reproduce

# Create a project
# Create a custom field, add this custom field to the project as required
# On the project click on the side button for the backlog
# Inside the backlog click on the field "What needs to be done?", fulfill with a text and hit enter
# On the next screen, click on the top button *Configure Fields* and then click on the *Where is my Field?* option.

h3. Expected result

The dialog box would appear to type the field you wish to see.

h3. Actual Result

The spinning wheel keeps turning and the dialog box never loads.

h3. Environment

# JIRA v1000.1110.1

h3. Workaround

Click on the top button for creating new issues, there the where is my field loads fine.
fields.summary: Where is my field does not load when creating issues directly from the backlog

fields.description: As summary is a mandatory field on issue collector, it would be good if we can provide an ability to rename summary field on issue collector, as summary is not useful in certain circumstances and it could be renamed to something else
fields.summary: Ability to rename summary field on Issue Collector

fields.description:
It would be great if JIRA could enable the functionality to change the "Type" (Standard or Sub-task) of an issue type after it was created.

Additionally, the type of issue type could be configurable per project.

e.g: I have an issue type *Task* on my site:
 * For project A, it is a *Standard* Issue Type.
 * For project B, it is a *Sub-Task* Issue Type
fields.summary: Convert Standard issue type to Sub-Task after it was created

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Certain date fields on CSV export are not being displayed correctly when viewed on Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an instance with *dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm* date format:
 !Date settings.png|thumbnail! 
# Use the Export Excel CSV feature.

h3. Expected Results
The 'Created' column, for example, would list all dates in a uniform format.

h3. Actual Results
Certain issues are rendering the date as  *d/m/yyyy HH:mm*
!Date format.jpg|thumbnail! 

The dates are correctly rendered when the CSV file is opened on Apple Numbers or Open Office.

h3.Workaround
Use another sheet editor than Excel or Google Sheets.
fields.summary: Date format is inconsistent on CSV export when viewed on Excel/Google Sheets.
Unable to attach Excel file with Russian filename via email

fields.description: Having the ability to produce the release notes within JIRA in markdown format would be fabulous addition.
fields.summary: Markdown Format for Release Notes

fields.description: This functionality was available and used frequently by our user base in classic boards to communicate readiness for next phases.  In addition to adding ability for more flags, we would also like the have the ability to place it in specific spots in the summary and or detail via schemes.
fields.summary: Similar to JSWSERVER2268, we would like the ability to use multiple flags in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
CSV import result displaying wrong completion number of issues. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 1000.1092.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform CSV import that having 9998 number of issue. 
# Wait until the CSV import is completed.

h3. Expected Results
It should display :-
{panel}
1 project and 9998 issue completed successfully!
{panel}

h3. Actual Results
But it display :-
{panel}
1 project and 998 issue completed successfully!
{panel}
 However, in the details log in mention :-
{noformat}
9998 issues successfully created
{noformat}

Refer below screenshot :-
 !Screen Shot 2017-07-06 at 9.22.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2017-07-07 at 7.12.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: CSV import result displaying wrong completion issue number

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Workload pie and Average Time in Status chart throwing "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource." 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add "Workload pie chart gadget" or "Average time in status" to dashboard
# Select any filter - !image-2017-07-07-15-46-38-363.png|thumbnail! 
# Cannot Save

h3. Expected Results

# Workload pie chart should appear

h3. Actual Results

 !image-2017-07-07-15-47-45-819.png|thumbnail! 

{panel:title=Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}
This only happens when the Issues in the selected filter/project do not have a value for the *Time to report field on* (eg. time spent).

As soon as a value is added to the field, the error message goes away.

{panel}
fields.summary: Dashboard gadgets throwing error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The JIRA Import Wizard dialog is misleading.

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.1110.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the JIRA Import Wizard: https://{instance}.atlassian.net/secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!start.jspa

h3. Expected Results
* It should not advise that attachments should be the top-level directory.

h3. Actual Results
* It stated that <JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments directory (with attachments as the top-level directory, or project keys within attachments as the top-level directory).
 
h3. Notes
* It would be better to change the structure dialog as stated on the Importing Issues Documentation.
JIRA-backup-20161021
├── activeobjects.xml
├── entities.xml
├── data
│   ├── attachments
│   └── avatars
└── logos
fields.summary: The JIRA Import Wizard dialog is misleading

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Export to csv uses both a carriage return and a linefeed for multiline data


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for issues (which have multi-line data in some fields) in Issue Navigator
# Export to CSV all fields

h3. Expected Results
Data is exported to CSV and can be viewed correctly in Excel.

h3. Actual Results
Data is exported to CSV but does not render correctly in some versions of Excel

h3. Notes
Two csv files attached.
[^csv saved from excel.csv]  [^Export to CSV all fields JIRA] 

The jira one uses both a carriage return and a linefeed which results in the file not loading correctly in Excel.
However, if you create a simple file in Excel, include some data with a line break in it and then save it as a csv, you see that the line break within the data uses just a linefeed.
fields.summary: Export to CSV formatting multiline text

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The import  feature sometimes got stuck on "JIRA Import progress", however, the import finishes successfully.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to System
 # Under IMPORT AND EXPORT select *JIRA Import*
 # Follow the steps to import

h3. Expected Results

The import is finished correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The process got stuck on "JIRA Import progress" and it gives no error message or warning, however, the import completes successfully after some time, although no "Acknowledge" message appears.
 !Screen Shot 2017-07-05 at 10.49.28 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

The problem seems to be intermittent.
fields.summary: JIRA Importing get stuck  "JIRA Import progress"
Some WebHook Variables not Working

fields.description:
It would be great to restrict specific users to receive notifications using the notification scheme.

Explaining better:

If I configure any kind of notifications with the *Current assignee*, I would like to be able to restrict a specific user (that is the assignee on some issues) to receive the notification. 

Of course that you can configure the notifications scheme in different ways (Groups, project roles) that don't match the user, however, it is really cumbersome to apply when you already have started working on issues.
fields.summary: Allow Notification Scheme to restrict specific users to receive notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for JIRA Issues using the Search box in the top right corner of the UI, the search can be slow. JIRA appears to have done nothing after executing the search, but after 20-40 seconds, the search results are returned. This only applies when searching for a text string. The issue doesn't appear when searching by field e.g. 'summary' or 'description'.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On any JIRA page, use the Search box and type in a word that you expect to appear in issues, then hit Enter

h3. Expected Results
 * Search results are (almost)instantly returned

h3. Actual Results
 * JIRA appears to do nothing, search results are returned 20-40 seconds afterward

h3. Workaround
 * Instead of using the Search box, search for issues using JIRA's advanced search:
 ## Go to Issues > Search for issues
 ## Enter "Advanced Mode"
 ## Type in {{summary ~ YOUR_SEARCH_TERM OR description ~ YOUR_SEARCH_TERM}}.
 * Avoid using the {{text}} field in this Advanced mode when searching for issues, instead use any other available fields to return the desired results. For a list of available fields, please see: [Advanced searching fields reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-DescriptionDescription]
 * Use the advanced search feature e.g. description ~'worklog' - this query will search the Description field of all issues for 'worklog'. A guide on how to use the advanced search can be found here: [Advanced searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-764478330.html]
fields.summary: Searching for issues is slow when using the Search box in the top right corner of the UI

fields.description:
When I enter a board filter using names that are very clear to us, after saving it, JIRA turns the names into numbers. For example, our board filter now looks like this:

{{project in (11701, 11609, 11603, 11803, 11602, 11605, 15300, 10006, 16802, 16800, 16801, 14002, 15201) AND "Team Assigned" is EMPTY OR "Team Assigned" = "Team 1" ORDER BY Rank ASC}}

Now I have to remove one project from the filter and I have no clue which it is.

It would not be too bad if it seems impossible to find out what project the number stands for! I can't even open a project URL with a project ID.

Suggestion: make IDs visible to it's easy to check what the project ID is.

Suggestion: make a project URL accept a project ID.

Suggestion: do not replace values the user has typed in.
fields.summary: board filter uses numbers that are untraceable back to project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When opening an issue after search it from a filter, after refreshing the page, the fields on the Issue View are no longer editable by clicking on the field name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a filter
# Open an issue from this filter
# Refresh the page

Reproducible on Windows using Firefox, Chrome, IE and Microsoft Edge.

h3. Expected Results
The fields in the Issue Detail View are editable exactly as it was before refreshed the page.

h3. Actual Results
The fields are no longer editable. The pencil icon is no longer shown when mouse hovering the fields.

h3.Workaround
- Go back to the filter, open the issue again and edit the field before refreshing the page.
fields.summary: After refresh the Issue View page, the fields are no longer editable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Cannot force the transition validator to validate more than one checkbox. When using a checkbox custom field with multiple values, you cannot add validator on this field to validate all the values of the field. It's only possible to create a validator to check the field itself and when transitioning the issue, if only one checkbox is marked, it will transition the issue properly instead of throw the error informing to mark all checkboxes.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to add a validator to check all the values from a checkbox custom field.
h3. Workaround
 - Create one custom field for each checkbox value and create a validator to each of those custom fields.
 - Use conditions instead of validators.
fields.summary: Add the ability to create a validator to check all the checkboxes from a checkbox custom field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The task for re-ordering subtasks from an issue is quite slow, it takes a few seconds to each change to be loaded and you be able to change order again. This can get worse depending on an issue's load.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make reordering subtasks an AJAX call and not a fully submission.

h3. Why this is important
To avoid nuisances, especially when having lots of subtasks to re-order, a task that should be simple is taking quite a time.
fields.summary: Make reordering subtasks an AJAX call and not a fully submission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a setup where JIRA cloud is configured with SAML to connect to MS Azure and MS Azure is connected further to a self-hosted [ADFS|https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb897402.aspx], JIRA mobile app (iOS) will not be able to complete the redirects on login.


h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud configured with SAML to connect to MS Azure and further to a self-hosted [ADFS|https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb897402.aspx]

cloud.atlassian.net -> login.microsoftonline.com -> self-hosted.com/adfs/ls/auth


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA iOS mobile app
# Enter the cloud instance URL
# Enter a verified domain email address to redirect to MS Azure
# Enter the same verified domain email address

h3. Expected Results

Login screen should redirect to the ADFS login form

h3. Actual Results

Login screen will hang on *redirecting....*

 !redirect.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Redirects are working properly when logging in via a desktop browser or via the iOS mobile browser
fields.summary: JIRA mobile app login cannot handle MS Azure redirect

fields.description: We need auto saving feature of the issue which is being created but for some reason can be interrupted before saving (creation) e.g.: electricity down, workstation reboot, browser crash. It is very often situation when JIRA users loose their unsaved issues.
fields.summary: Issue draft - add autosaving of the issue before creation

fields.description:
h3. Symptom

"Basic" search button not available in issue navigator where JQL query contains a username with capital letters.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an user with capital letter(s) in name (e.g. Testuser)
# Browse to the issue navigator and search for this user either in the "reporter" or "assignee" field
# You will be able to search either in Basic or Advanced mode
# In the issue navigator using Advanced mode, search for the user either in the "reporter" or "assignee" field
# The "Basic" search will be disabled
# If you hove on the "Basic" link, the message "This query is too complex to display in Simple mode" will be shown

h3. Expected behavior

Be able to search in Basic and Advanced mode

h3. Current behavior

Basic search is disabled.

h3. Workaround

In the JQL make the capital letters lowercase in the username (e.g. testuser)

h3. Additional information
 * This behavior is *not consistent*. In some cases, using the username in its lower case letters work, but that is not always true. Below, there are some examples of usernames where the workaround did work and some other examples where it did not work
||Username||Lower case username||Test Result||
|TEST|test|Basic button was displayed (/)|
|testUSER|testuser|Basic button was displayed (/)|
|Test user|test user|Basic button was displayed (/)|
|testing User|testing user|Basic button was still not displayed (x)|
|User Test|user test|Basic button was still not displayed (x)|
fields.summary: Usernames with capital letters disable 'Basic' search
When quering the issues from the REST API, fix versions should be sorted from the latest to the oldest
